articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as Australia play Pakistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Australia v Pakistan - clips, radio & text

articles.description: England beat Australia 42-7 in Wellington to make a winning start to WXV1, the new global tournament in women's rugby.
articles.title: England begin WXV1 with six-try win over Australia

articles.description: Build-up to the return of the Premier League after the international break with 16 pre-match news conferences, plus Women's Champions League draw.
articles.title: Football latest & Premier League news conferences

articles.description: Former British number one Emma Raducanu says she is constantly asking questions and challenging her coaches.
articles.title: Coaches can't keep up with my questions - Raducanu

articles.description: Steven Finn tells BBC Sport that England can capitalise on South Africa's defeat by Netherlands by reopening old wounds in Saturday's match in Mumbai.
articles.title: 'England should target South Africa's old wounds'

articles.description: Former England number one Karen Bardsley takes a deeper look at why goalkeeper Robert Sanchez might turn out to be Chelsea's smartest signing from their recent spending spree.
articles.title: Why Sanchez could be Chelsea’s smartest signing

articles.description: Australia opener David Warner hits the roof of the stadium in Bangalore with a massive six off Pakistan bowler Haris Rauf in their ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023 group stage match.
articles.title: 'Monster hit!' Warner hits roof with massive six

articles.description: Newcastle's Bruno Guimaraes and Joelinton sit down with Football Focus' Caroline de Moraes to talk about their Brazilian bromance, Champions League football and life in the Premier League.
articles.title: Guimaraes & Joelinton: Newcastle's boys from Brazil

articles.description: Eddie Howe says Newcastle midfielder Sandro Tonali, who is being investigated for alleged illegal betting activity, has had a "difficult couple of weeks" but is available to face Crystal Palace.
articles.title: Tonali available after 'difficult couple of weeks'

articles.description: Bayern Munich say full-back Noussair Mazraoui "never meant to cause any irritation" by sharing a video in support of Palestine.
articles.title: Bayern say Mazraoui 'rejects terror and war'
